events.name: GDG Meetup January: Gradle, BlackBerry Android Tools

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
The first GDG meetup in 2014 will take place January 14th at Garage Bilk in Düsseldorf.

We have to topics.

1. Introduction to Gradle, Randy Gupta (SCARATEC IT-Consulting GmbH)
Gradle is a build automation tool that strives to succeed Ant and Maven. Time for us to take a look at this promising pice of software. The talk will give an overview about how gradle works.
2. Generate revenues with your Android App on the BlackBerry 10 Platform, by Kamel Lajili (BlackBerry Deutschland GmbH)
The BlackBerry 10 Platform included from the beginning an optimized Android runtime inside. This had some limitations so that only 60…70% of android apps were functional after conversion. Now with the upcoming release[masked] we improved that runtime considerably and we made it possible to simply tap apk files to get them installed on your BlackBerry 10 devices. No conversions are required any more. Join me in this session to get more informed on that and why it’s worth it to come to the BlackBerry platform with your Android App

events.name: Dart Flight School

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
Dart is a new language for scalable web app engineering. It has been recently released in version 1.0 and is now ready for production. All modern browsers (both desktop and mobile) can run Dart web apps, thanks to the Dart-to-JavaScript compiler.

The Google Developer Group Düsseldorf is hosting the Dart Flight School with a free one day codelab for you to take off with Dart!

We start on February 15th at 10am (open ending). Prerequisites are a Laptop with a working Dart-Editor or Intellij IDEA with dart-support. Learn more here: https://www.dartlang.org/codelabs/darrrt/

Please note that we try to avoid spending time on installing IDE etc. during the event. So please try to get it up and running prior to the event. Just in case you have any trouble installing, please contact us in advance, we strive to give you support. If it still don't work, please check-in at the venue at 9am so that we can give you support on site.

The participation is free but it is required to register on the event page here.

events.name: GDG May Meetup

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
We are happy to annonce our next meetup which will take place on may 12th at 7pm at our usual location: Our first topic will be Android and Automotive. A talk held by +Resul Kocyigit who'll share his experiences from one of this latest projects.

The second talk will be held by +Randy Gupta about Polymer. Polymer is a library that uses the latest web technologies to let you create custom HTML elements. Build anything from a button to a complete application as an encapsulated, reusable element that works across desktop and mobile.

Our third talk is currently in preparation but we are positive that +Viet Anh Nguyen will tell us about the Android Wear Project and its SDK.

Make sure you don't miss this meetup!﻿

events.name: Android Wear Hackathon

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
Win an Android Wear powered device

The GDG Düsseldorf is organizing a Hackthon for Android enthusiasts. The goal is develop an App for Android Wear. The best App will be awarded with a voucher for a watch powered by Android Wear at our I/O Extended Event on June 25th. Vouchers can be redeemed as soon as devices become available for sale in summer 2014.

We are starting the hackathon with a codelab for Android Wear. We will also support newbies on their way to become real android heros. The roules are simple:

1. You can start coding right now (if you like) using the Android Wear SDK http://goo.gl/PG9Ogu
2. You have to register your App in person at the Hackathon event (June 19th, 7pm)
3. The App must be Open Source (not necessarily GPL but we want to see the code) and code must be made publicly available.
4. The App must be your intellectual property
5. You'll get a 5 Minute slot on our I/O Extended event to make a presentation of your App
6. The Audience of the I/O Extended will vote for the best App

Code for fun! Legal recourse is excluded.

The Hackathon event will take place at the Garage Bilk on June 19th a 7pm. The Participation is free but you need to register your attendance (G+ or meetup).

Cheers
Randy

events.name: DevFest 2014 Düsseldorf - Networking, Android and Web Development

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
The biggest Google related event in the region carefully crafted for you by the GDG Düsseldorf community will take place on October 26t! Expect a free, multi track conference organized by the developer community of Düsseldorf and focused on networking and exchange of knowledge.

About a 3rd of our members are not only developers but also entrepreneurs. Therefore we are especially happy to welcome Maxim Mai from Google Dublin in his former hometown Düsseldorf, who will give us valuable insights about how to get the most revenue from your Apps. Don’t miss the chance to ask your questions directly to a pro from Google.

The conference will cover numerous Topics from the Android Ecosystem like Android Wear, Android L and also artificial intelligence applied to Android devices.

Those who are more interested on web development will be excited about Polymer.dart, Google Go and Micro Services with Docker.

The conference will be also accompanied by a free workshop for gradle. The workshop will strive to crack your issues with gradle. We will not focus on promotion for gradle but on solving your real world problems. So bring in your laptop and let’s see how we can manage your build.

The conference will be closed by our After Party with hot Pizza and a lot of networking.

Learn more about this awesome conference, the programm and our speakers on our event website

Attendance is free but requires registration. Seats are limited so please make sure to get your conference ticket here.

This conference is sponsored by Grandcentrix. Grandcentrix is Germany’s quality leader for native Retail, Connected Home and Media apps.

events.name: March Meetup GDG Düsseldorf - Google Launch and Android Work

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
Update

------------------------------------------------------------

Hi GDGs,

we have a change in our agenda. Unfortunately +Resul Kocyigit can not attend tomorrow, he is diseased. His talk on#androidwork will be  shifted to the next event in April. We are sorry, just stay tuned and we wish Resul all best.  The rest of the agenda will stay like it is ;-)

Your GDG﻿

------------------------------------------------------------

Did you ever hear about Google Launch?
And have you heard about Google Launchpad?

Google Launch - a platform supporting new startups and entrepreneurs in different stages of starting a business using the Google developers platform. Google Launch is an inspiring environment which will help setting you up for success, through the Start -> Build -> Grow phases of a new entrepreneurship. We are happy to introduce Tatiana Chapovalova as a speaker for the next GDG Düsseldorf event March 24. Tatiana knows much about Google Launch, after having attended Google Launchpad, a week long Entrepreneurship bootcamp, in Berlin. Tatiana will come and tell us more about Google Launch, and tell us about her experience from Google Launchpad

Special thanks to Randy Gupta for connecting with Tatiana and inviting her to speak at our next event! We are excited to learn more! After Tatiana’s introduction to Google Launch, our long term member and co-organiser Resul Kocyigit will introduce Android Work - an updated platform ready for business environments! We are very excited to hear more from both Tatiana and Resul, come and join us Tuesday, March 24!

 1. Freifunk Rheinland - Free open Wifi for everyone

2. GDG Düsseldorf Charity App kickoff

1. Freifunk Rheinland

Daniel and Mic from Freifunk Rheinland will come present their free Wifi project; Here's the short introduction from their site:

"Freifunk ist die Möglichkeit jedem Bürger, der sich in der Nähe eines Freifunk-WLAN-Netzwerks befindet, einen kostenfreien Zugang zum Netzwerk zu ermöglichen. Freifunk ist gemeinnützig und wird von ehrenamtlichen Helfern in Eigenregie aufgebaut und gewartet."

Since we're techies, expect high level router firewalls and network protocol topics!

More info: https://freifunk-rheinland.net/was-ist-freifunk

2. Resul will introduce the GDG Düsseldorf Charity Project in cooperation with betterplace.org

More info at www.betterplace.org

events.name: GDG September Meetup

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
Hi GDG Fellows!

After our chilly summer break we are having our next meetup on September 24th with some exciting topics for you and we are expecting nothing less but a full house. So make sure to get your seat and pizza with these exciting topics:

Randy will introduce us to Eleasticsearch which is a very powerful search engine build on Lucene. You'll get an introduction and also some samples from an actual project at SCARATEC.

Frederik will give a presentation about Googles Mobile Vision API. The API finds human faces in photos, videos, or live streams. It also finds and tracks positions of facial landmarks such as the eyes, nose, and mouth. But you can also scan barcodes with this versatile API. So don't miss it!

Dittmar and Resul will give us some updates about some charity projects in conjunction with our last meetups topic Freifunk and also on the work of betterplace.org.

We are looking forward to meet you!

Pizza is sponsored by SCARATEC.

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
It is that time again! Our OCTOBER meetup is here! This time we are very excited to have an external speaker - Douglass Sillars from US. Doug is an android specialist, and his talk,  "High Performance Android Apps: Easy Tips for Speed, Power and Data" will give us some very concrete tips, his job at AT&T is "to help developers make their apps run faster, use the network more efficiently, and save battery usage" - and that's a direct quote.

We are very excited to have the opportunity to invite you to meet with and listen to Doug talk. This is a very special opportunity that shouldn't be missed - it isn't often our calendar matches the calendars of international travellers.

So come and join us!

And for those who sadly can't make it - take the opportunity to check out the free tool from AT&T - the  "Application Resource Optimizer"  (ARO) -

developer.att.com/ARO

Hope to see you there! 

And stay tuned! While we haven't had our October event yet, November is already in the planning, in November we step away from Android for a while and focus on Web. ﻿

events.name: GDG March Meetup

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
Hi GDG'ers,

please save the date for our next meetup. We have prepared some exciting topics for you. 

The first talk will deal with Game Development for Android and Chromecast with Unity:

Google demonstrated at the I/O 2015 how you can use Google Cast to play games on your TV. At the end of 2015, Google released the beta of the Cast Remote Display Plugin for Unity, the leading game engine in the mobile market. In this talk you will see how to make a simple quiz in Unity and to integrate Google Cast into the game. The talk will be held Abdülhamit Yilmaz who is a professional Unity Developer.

The second talk covers an architectual topic: 

Microservices – Why?Microservices are getting more and more attention in the last time regarding to nearlyinfinite ressources that were utilized by clouds. The topic is humongous and very broadspread over different areas -- from project management to the whole development process.Let's examine when you may or may not use this architecture and which upsides and pitfalls will await you! Presented by Sascha Düpre.

As always we will serve hot pizza sponsored by SCARATEC IT-Consulting GmbH

events.name: Study Jam Weekend - Android for Beginners - with GDG Düsseldorf
events.description:
Have you got an interest in Technology?

Are you curious to learn programming?

Do you want to become a creator of technology but don’t know where to start?

Do you have a smartphone, or an interest in Smartphones? Do you specifically have an interest in Android?

Well, this might just be the perfect opportunity for you!

The topic for this year’s Study Jam season is Android for Beginners.

What IS a Study Jam? Study Jams are community driven events, where we get together to learn. The great thing about Study Jams is that we can support and inspire each other - and, because it is an organised event, we also have a facilitator who will be able to assist when we get stuck. We will be using the Udacity course Android for Beginners for this Study Jam.

You don’t need to know anything about Android programming to take this course, what

 you need is

• An interest to learn 

• A computer (one that you have permissions to install on.)

• A bit of free time

• Some patience. You will not become a software developer over one weekend - but it will get you started, if you have an interest, and patience.

It is good if you have an Android phone, for testing, but it isn't a must.

If you have programming experience from before - well, that doesn't hurt, but it is not necessary. You DO need an interest in technology though - and it is helpful if you have an interest in problem solving. 

This course is however aimed at those who either

• Are new to programming or 

• Have programming experience but never used Android

GDG:s around the globe are organising Study Jams this season. In Düsseldorf we have decided to run our Study Jam over a weekend, other groups may have a different setup - however we are all using the same course material. The course on Udacity assumes 6 hours of work per week for 4 weeks. This means you will not finish during the Study Jam, but you will get a very good start.

After going through the course and finishing your project, within a set time - you have some time after the Study Jam weekend - you will even get a certificate, and Google offer a discount on their nano degrees. So not only do you have the opportunity to meet cool people, learn a new technology, challenge yourself, you actually have a chance to get something in the end as well. 

Some participants from the Study Jam sessions from around the globe will also be offered opportunity to join Google Launchpad with completed app, pending app quality 

Who is this for? As mentioned above, this is for people who wants to learn to program for Android. You do NOT need previous Android experience.  You don't even need to have Android Studio installed before you arrive (but if you do, that doesn't hurt)

Where? And how?
Our sponsor, Scaratec, are kind enough to offer us to use their space. Notice! Space is limited, so signup is absolutely essential! 

We have an excellent and very experienced Android developer who will help us facilitate the event and guide us and help us if we get stuck - Pascal Welsch. We are very happy and excited to have Pascal, who is an engaged member of our community who held several talks and taught us about Android before, be our trainer for this course.

Additionally we also have Wolfram Rittmeyer helping us out - if we can't make it with these two on our side, then I don't know how - Wolfram and Pascal are extremely professional, calm and very good at explaining. 

Thank you both for what you do for our community!

What you need to prepare

Check the Hardware requirements (follow the link)

The course itself you will find here (follow the link)

We will send out a link to all participants with the link to register on Udacity.

Reserve your spot NOW - we offer this for a limited number of attendees, to allow every student to get enough attention and to make sure we have enough room for everyone.

All reservations via Meetup ONLY. You have to make sure you have a confirmed spot on Meetup (waiting list available).

IF you sign up and find out can’t make it, please make sure you cancel your spot so someone else can step in instead.

If you DO know Android already, please leave space for those who don’t - come and join GDG Düsseldorf/Women Techmakers at one of our monthly events instead, where we discuss and learn new technologies - maybe you even have an interesting topic you would like to present?

PS! The event starts ON TIME. and runs over the whole weekend. We expect to be running from 10 to aprox. 5 pm (17:00) both days but if the team decides together that you want to call it a day earlier - that's up to the group. Learning is fun but can be quite exhausting...

events.name: #GDGDus Responsive Webapps & IoT - Let's get Physical

venue.name: Coworking Space GarageBilk UG & Co KG

events.description:
#GDGDUS - GDG Düsseldorf - and WTM - Women Techmakers Düsseldorf have our next meetup coming up - July 27 at Garagespace Bilk

First an introduction to Progressive Web apps and then we will talk Google Nearby API, Edystone, beacons and  Internet of Things in an Android talk. 

Christopher, who attended the Progressive Web Apps event in Amsterdam earlier this year will guide us through Progressive Webapps, and Pascal will present his talk from Droidcon in Berlin in June, "Let's get physical - with Nearby and Eddystone" (link here).

And what IS a "Progressive Web App"? In short, directly from the source:

• Progressive - Work for every user, regardless of browser choice because they’re built with progressive enhancement as a core tenet.

• Responsive - Fit any form factor: desktop, mobile, tablet, or whatever is next.

• Connectivity independent - Enhanced with service workers to work offline or on low quality networks.

• App-like - Feel like an app to the user with app-style interactions and navigation because they’re built on the app shell model. 

 In short, Progressive Web Apps are enablers, especially with the offline functionality, improving the user experience for your users  and potentially increasing business for business owners. As designers and developers we need to understand the latest and the greatest - and Christopher will give us our first introduction. 

Pascal Welsch needs no further introduction, an experienced Android developer who is a long time member of GDG and have presented many interesting topics - now Pascal is back. 

We will be learning more about Edystone beacons, the nearby API (Trello uses this, for example) and lots more. Put a beacon on your coffee mug and never lose it again? 

As a little add-on, a surprise, we also have an interesting an inspiring talk about something completely different - related to tech, of course, but this one takes beyond the traditional space - come and join and see for yourself. 

As always, networking, having a snack, catching up with everyone and getting engaged in new and interesting topics is half the fun - so come and join us even if you don't immediately feel you can use what you learn from the talks, I can guarantee that you'll always learn something, if you come with an open mind and bring a smile. Our discussions are always interesting.

events.name: #GDGDus January Meetup: Kubernetes and Software Architecture

venue.name: SIPGATE GMBH

events.description:
Hello GDG:ers,

We, Google Developer Group Düsseldorf are having our first meetup in 2017 on January 26th at the Sipgate office: Gladbacher Str. 74, 40219 Düsseldorf First up is the presentation around macro- and microarchitecture with Gernot Schulmeister. 

Gernot Schulmeister:  Software architecture becomes -> is a developer skill

The division between macro and microarchitecture means more freedom but also more responsibility for developers. To cope with these requirements architecture skills become more and more necessary for developers. In this talk Gernot Schulmeister will discuss the advantages of Macro and Micro Architecture, present the tasks of an architect, the process of an architecture design, heuristics and architecture styles. 

Gernot Schulmeister works for TeamWFP in Mönchengladbach and is a TYPO3 and Angular developer. In his spare time he likes to attend bar camps and meetups.

Next up 
Randy Gupta: Kubernetes – Mastering the Clusters

Kubernetes has changed the way we look at data centres. What before was a bunch of commodity hardware, virtual machines or a cloud platform can now be handled as one big computer. Kubernetes manages your infrastructure for you, not matter if it is just one virtual machine, your own hardware or the cloud. 

This presentation gives an overview of how kubernetes can make your live easier and your services more resilient.

Randy Gupta is a Software Architect, CEO of SCARATEC and GDG Düsseldorf organiser.

After presentations pizza will be served and you’ll have a chance  to network and mingle with the other attendees and speakers.

The admission is as always for our monthly meetups free, and thanks to our sponsor sipgate there is also pizza for everyone. 

We are looking forward to meet you!

Your GDG Organiser team

events.name: #GDGDUS evening with connected devices - IoT, Bluetooth and Android Things

venue.name: Simvelop GmbH

events.description:
February 15 we host our second Meetup with the GDG Düsseldorf group (Google Developer Group) for 2017.

#GDGDUS - A GDG Düsseldorf evening with IoT and Android Things

As always we try and have an interesting mix of talks, so there is something for everyone - and new for this year is that we switch locations - so make sure you read to the end.

This time we have 3 talks by 3 different speakers - Pascal, Wolfram and Miki, who is also our host for this evening.

"A whirlwind tour of Android Things” -  Wolfram Rittmeyer, Android GDE (Google Developer Expert) with long and broad experience is giving an introduction into Android Things, how to get started, what you can do with it, and what APIs exist. You will also hear about where it differs from normal Android development and where the use of existing Android libraries and integration can help your IoT projects.

Miki, Miroslav  from Simvelop is going to hold a short talk on IoT, and show us what he has been doing lately.

And last but not least we have Pascal talking about Bluetooth 5.

Bluetooth 5 -> The Bluetooth SIG released the specification of Bluetooth 5 in December '16. This release will lay the foundation of future IoT devices: longer range (4x), faster speed (2x), bigger messages (8x)

Pascal Welsch from Grandcentrix will cover the new possibilities, backwards compatibility and how this new protocol will affect future products. Grandcentrix is Germany’s largest systems integrator specialized in the end-to-end creation of digital products and services for the Internet of Things, Smart Home and Mobile Commerce, and we are excited to once again have Pascal come and present.

Our February event will be held at Simvelop, Volmerswerther Str. 80-86, 40221 Düsseldorf,  a familiar location to those of you who have come to our IO Extended events - thank you very much Simvelop for hosting us! Without the support of you and other sponsors we wouldn't be here!

As always our monthly meetups are free of charge, so come and join us for a great evening of mingling, networking and great tech talks. And yes, there will be snacks as well. 

GDG is an open independent community and we welcome everyone, all that is needed is an open mind and an interest in technology. We encourage beginners as well as very experienced techies to come and take part in the interesting discussions that always happen - looking forward to seeing you there!

Remember that we are always open for new speakers as well - if you have an interesting topic to share, let one of know and we will do our best to fit you in at one of our events. We especially welcome newcomers! 

Notice! The order of the talks are not decided, so make sure you try and be  there from the start! 

See you there!

Your GDG organiser team

events.name: #GDGDus Meetup: Shredder Chess, Google Cloud Plattform and Androids UiAutomator

venue.name: trivago GmbH

events.description:
Hi GDG´ers,

our next meetup is happening on April 3rd 2017 with some amazing talks and hot pizza waiting for you! The event takes place at trivago GmbH, Bennigsen-Platz 1, 40474 Düsseldorf. We’ll have three talks by our community members Stefan, Resul and Randy.

Stefan Meyer-Kahlen: Building a world champion computer chess program

If you ever wondered how to develop a chess program that has won 18(!) world championship titles, you must not miss this talk and opportunity to meet Stefan!

Stefan is the developer and architect of Shredder Computer Chess and he’ll talk about how computers play chess in contrast to how humans play it and how to build a world champion computer chess program. You will get an idea about the life and work or a professional computer chess programmer.

Randy Gupta: The Who´s Who of Google Cloud Plattform

App Engine, App Engine Flexible Environment, Compute Engine, Container Engine, Cloud Functions and many more are making it difficult to decide which product can be used for your needs. This talk strives to give you an overview and classification of the different environments and how to use it. 

Randy Gupta is a Software Architect, CEO of SCARATEC and GDG Düsseldorf organiser.

Resul Kocyigit: Androids UiAutomator and the reborn of the SmartMonkey

The UiAutomator is a fixed component in Android Testing. A nice and easy blackbox testing tool. What happens if you put a little AI into UiAutomator? You will get a huge quality assurance. The talks is about the technical opportunities in UiAutomator, which you should not miss in your daily development.

Resul is our long term member, GDG Organizer and a professional in negotiations for our pizza delivery.

Schedule

Pizza will be served between 6pm and 7pm. Presentations will be starting at 7.15pm

events.name: #GDGDus Meetup: Google Assistant, Kotlin in production, Cloud App Development

venue.name: SIPGATE GMBH

events.description:
Hi GDG:ers,

the next GDG meetup is around the corner and no one has seen it coming ;-)

Sorry for the short notice! We all have been very busy lately but the more exciting are the topics for the next meetup that you must not miss:


Extending the Google Assistant

Actions on Google allow you to engage users using the voice interface of the Google Assistant. Wolfram Rittmeyer shows you what is possible within the Google Assistant right on time to prepare for Google Home's upcoming market start in Germany. He will show a small sample as to how to use the Actions SDK and an example as to how to use api.ai for your apps. If all goes well, you will see one sample running on his AIY voice kit device (https://aiyprojects.withgoogle.com/voice/).

Kotlin in production - one year later

Thanks to the community, Kotlin became the new language for Android Apps. Pascal Welsch is already using Kotlin for over an year in production and will talk about his learnings covering features and tools you should use and other which are too risky for a long term project.Thinking about adopting Kotlin in your project? Pascal shows the process of adopting Kotlin in all Android Apps at grandcentrix.

Best practices in cloud application development

Web application development is not exactly a new discipline. However, if you'd like to take the full advantage of cloud technologies there are a few things that you should keep in mind BEFORE you start writing your application. Architectural decisions have to be made to ensure your application is scalable and maintainable. Randy Gupta will be talking about best practices in cloud application development. 

We’ll be having dinner and networking at 6pm. Talks are starting at 7pm.

The admission is as always for our monthly meetups free, and thanks to our sponsor sipgate there is also food and beverages for everyone! 

We are looking forward to meet you!

Your GDG Organiser team

events.name: Flutter and Android Things by GDG Düsseldorf #GDGDus #Vodafone

venue.name: Vodafone GmbH

events.description:
Hi GDG´ers,

we are proudly presenting an upcoming Meetup hosted at Vodafone with talks by Dylan Dorst and Said Tahsin Dane.

Please additionally get a free ticket over eventbrite.
https://www.eventbrite.de/e/gdgdus-vodafone-flutter-and-android-things-tickets-37818294537

Dylan is arriving from Netherlands for this event and will be speaking about Flutter. The second talk is about Android Things and will be held by Google Developer Expert (https://developers.google.com/experts/people/said-tahsin-dane) Said Tahsin Dane from Berlin.

The event will take place on october 5th at the Vodafone Campus, Ferdinand-Braun-Platz 1, 40549 Düsseldorf (https://goo.gl/maps/SXpE2kh5kyM2). Doors open at 7 p.m. Don’t miss out!

Of course there will be food and drinks and you’ll have a chance to network and mingle with the other attendees and speakers. As usual, it’s free of charge.

Dylan Dorst

Is Flutter the next big thing in creating multi platform apps? Google seems to think so. Let’s see if Flutter lets us create apps for Android and IOS and can keep up with Native apps. To test this Dylan decided to create an app for the blog Betty’s Kitchen (https://bettyskitchen.nl/) that runs on both Android and IOS and will walk you through how he did this and what he learned along the way.

“I'm an Android developer working at Karify (https://karify.com) where we are creating an E-health platform for mental health institutions to communicate, treat and manage clients. Occasional web developer/server admin for Bettyskitchen (https://bettyskitchen.nl) a food blog which is run by my wife. The current stack I work with is Android(Java), Symfony(PHP), Docker, Gitlab, Wordpress.”

Said Tahsin Dane

Android Things is the new version of Android designed to run on small connected development devices like Raspberry PI, Intel Edison etc. It runs Android Nougat and lets you build connected devices for a wide variety of consumer, retail, and industrial applications.

In this talk, we will talk about what it is and how you do Android development with it. Then we will briefly compare with the other alternative solutions. Lastly, we will see how easy it is to connect Google’s Firebase infrastructure to have cloud connected devices.

“I am a Google Developer Expert on Android and Firebase and work at Novoda, Berlin. I am an active member in GDG community enjoying organizing various conferences and hackathons. In addition I am involved and part part of GDG[X] - a GDG related open-source organization”

We are looking forward to see you on October 5th!
Your GDG Organiser team

events.description:

events.name: Learning culture and Kotlin DSL by GDG Düsseldorf #GDGDus #Vodafone

venue.name: Vodafone GmbH

events.description:
Hi GDG´ers,

we are proudly presenting an upcoming Meetup hosted at Vodafone with talks by Gisele Legionnet-Klees and Wolfram Rittmeyer.

The event will take place on february 1st at the Vodafone Campus, Ferdinand-Braun-Platz 1, 40549 Düsseldorf (https://goo.gl/maps/SXpE2kh5kyM2). Doors open at 7 p.m. Don’t miss out!

Of course there will be food and drinks and you’ll have a chance to network and mingle with the other attendees and speakers. As usual, it’s free of charge.

Gisele Legionnet-Klees

Towards a sustainable learning culture of curiosity

How might we design learning and school for a better future

The school and study model which was implemented 150 years ago is fading away. The industrial age is making way for the digital age.
In this interactive session, we will investigate how technology, learning and society can evolve together into a better future.

Gis (Gisèle) Legionnet-Klees is a designer and creative thinker. She is looking for ways to define technology that helps people grow.
www.legionnet.com
www.kinderdesignathon.de

Kotlin DSLs by Wolfram Rittmeyer

Kotlin is not just about null safety or data classes. Kotlin has much more to offer. One of the nice things is the ability to use Kotlin's features to create domain specific languages (DSLs).

In this talk you will see samples of DSLs from a wide variety of backgrounds like Spring, Android and Android testing. And you will learn how those DSLs work and how to create your own DSL based on that knowledge.

We are looking forward to see you on October 5th!
Your GDG Organiser team
events.how_to_find_us: Vodafone Court, the same location like last meetup at Vodafone

events.name: #GDGDus - Fingerprint Dialog AND Kubernetes for Java Developers

venue.name: Vodafone GmbH

events.description:
Hey GDG'ers,

we do continue and we never stop, the next meetup is coming with 2 amazing talks by Segun about Androids Fingerprint Dialog and Randy about Kubernetes for Java Developers.

Take a look at the abstracts, very interesting !!!

The location is set. Check the map. It is again the event "court" place at Vodafone Campus.

The location will be sponsored by Vodafone.

Topic: One Fingerprint Dialog to rule them all.

Abstract:
Recently, Android P developer preview was announced and there are a couple of exciting changes and new updates. Some of the changes include support for display cut-outs aka "notches", multi-camera APIs, support for indoor positioning with RTT and security updates such as a new unified fingerprint dialog API.

Fingerprint authentication is becoming increasingly popular in apps these days and developers have used the FingerPrintManager class to implement it in their apps. With this approach, the responsibility of implementing the UI lies on the developer. This has resulted in fragmentation and inconsistencies for the users.

In this talk, we shall be looking at the new Fingerprint Dialog API. We will look at the rationale behind this change, and how to implement the new APIs whether you are porting your old apps or starting from scratch. We will also look at how to handle results for the authentication and tips for failing gracefully.

Oluwasegun Famisa is an android expert and working for Trivago.

Kubernetes for Java Developers

Building production ready (micro) services with java and the details that need to be taken care of when you‘re planning to deploy your application to kubernetes. How health checks should be configured, memory leaks can be unveiled even in production and a short discussion about which base image should be used will be the subject of this talk.

Randy Gupta is a Software Architect, CEO of SCARATEC and GDG Düsseldorf organiser.

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2018 with GDG Düsseldorf

venue.name: trivago GmbH

events.description:
Google I/O is Google's yearly Developer Conference -and at Google I/O 2018 (https://events.google.com/io/) we are expected to learn about new and interesting things from Google, interesting for us developers, IT geeks and techies.

A Google I/O extended (https://events.google.com/io/extended/) event is an extension of the event, a great opportunity to get together, chat, listen to the keynotes, discuss further. Google I/O Extended are taking place across the globe, at the same time or around the time of Google I/O.

Of course we from GDG Düsseldorf - #GDGDUS - do the same!

Come and join us for our Google I/O extended on the first day of Google I/O, May 8 (the whole conference runs May 8-10, but the I/O Extended event is limited to one evening).

This year we are again at Trivago #trivago, who has offered to sponsor with location - thank you for that!

ATTENTION: Only when you are listed in meetup as "attending", you are able to enter the event. This is because of security reasons. So if you bring frieds, be sure he accepted via meetup.

Just like before we have a bunch of other activities planned so come and join us, learn more about GDG Düsseldorf, talk tech, and learn what news Google wants us to hear for 2018.

Space is limited, so make sure you sign up!

KEYNOTES starts at 19:00 sharp - we will watch the live stream from Google I/O in Mountain View.

However we open the doors for the main event already at 18:00. The event itself is on the 10th floor.

BRING your laptop, we'll be going through some code labs and there will be time for questions (of course you can come just for the networking and I/O keynotes as well, if you don't feel like bringing the laptop.)

After the Keynotes there will be time to mingle, discuss what was presented in the keynotes from Google, and much more - of course we'll have both food and drinks.

Remember to keep your RSVP up to date - cancel your attendance if you cannot make it, so someone else can join instead.

You can respond for you + one additional person - but if your friend/colleague isn't joining in the end, remember to remove the +1.

A waiting list is available. It is automatic, which means if the event is full but someone cancels, the people on the waiting list will automatically be moved to "attending" - so if you don't get a space but are waitlisted, remember to keep an eye on the mail and on the Meetup website.

A big THANK YOU goes to trivago (https://www.trivago.de/) who provides the location and more for this special event!

Thank you also to our other sponsors who have been and are sponsoring with all kind of things at all kinds of events - it is amazing to see the engagement from everyone.

NOTICE! We are still planning for and preparing this event so information might be updated. Stay tuned!

A SEPARATE event, with limited space will start earlier in the day, for those who happen to be free and want to start early with code labs. Stay tuned and keep an eye on Meetup to find out more! The smaller group joins the rest when the bigger event starts.

events.name: Game Development with Flutter, Amazon Alexa

venue.name: Vodafone GmbH

events.description:
We, the GDG Düsseldorf, are organizing our next meetup on tuesday march 26th at Vodafone. We will welcome Johannes Milke.

Johannes Milke is a Flutter Software Engineer from Berlin who recently graduated from FH Lübeck university. In his bachelor thesis, he has focused on evaluating Flutter and developing mobile business applications for service providers and their customers.

Johannes will talk about: Game Development with Flutter

Since 4th of December 2018, Flutter announced the integration of Flare with which it's possible to build complex animations in Flutter with minimum effort. After this talk which includes a live demo, you will be able to create your own animations with the Flare web tool and integrate and access them properly with Flutter. In the second part of the talk we will investigate how to build a simple game with the key concepts of general animations in Flutter.

Our second guest is Rafael Miranda:

Curious at heart, Rafael loves trying out new technologies. Exploring voice interfaces was love at first hearing. He organized hackathons and other events with focus on Alexa before joining Amazon. As a technical evangelist for Amazon Alexa, he educates developers, designers, enthusiasts, and businesses about voice technology.

From hearing train station announcements to a pleasant conversation, voice is a natural and ever-present part of most of our lives. We had to learn to click, type, and swipe to communicate with technology. Alexa uses the most natural form of communication, speech, to provide an intuitive interface. Using the Alexa Skills Kit (ASK), Rafael will show you how to build your first voice experience.

Our Agenda:
18:00 - 19:00 - Pizza's ready
19:00 - 19:45 - Game Development with Flutter
19:45 - 20:30 - Amazon Alexa
20:30 - … drinks and great discussions...

Big thank you to our sponsors Vodafone for providing the location and SCARATEC for the sponsoring the Pizza!

Cheers!
GDG Düsseldorf

upcoming.name: GDG Cloud Special: Breaking a world record using GCP, Google Assistant

venue.name: InVision AG

upcoming.description:
We are especially thrilled to announce that we will welcome Emma Haruka Iwao from Google who has recently broken the world record in calculating the (by far) most accurate value of pi. The second talk will be held by Amanda Cavallaro who is a Google Developer Expert for Google Assistant from London.

Breaking a world record using GCP

Emma has calculated 31.4 trillion digits of Pi in 2019 and broke the world record in the Pi computation. The process took about four months and 200 TiB of storage. Record-breaking Pi calculations have traditionally been done on supercomputers and special-made hardware, but Emma and her team did it on Cloud for the first time.

This talk will discuss the nature of the calculation, the architecture, challenges and techniques, and of course the brief history of Pi computation. Calculating Pi has been the speaker's childhood dream and this talk will also explain how the small dream grew to the new world record.

Building Conversational Actions Using Actions on Google

In this session, Amanda Cavallaro will describe the key components of Actions on Google, she is going to show you how to build and design assistant apps using tools such as dialogflow, google cloud platform, actions on google that will delight your users. They will be able to interact with your agents by using textual and voice conversational apps in a human-like conversational manner.

Our Agenda:
18:00 - 19:00 - Dinner's ready
19:00 - 19:45 - Building Conversational Actions Using Actions on Google
19:45 - 20:30 - Breaking a world record using GCP
20:30 - 22:00 - Clubmate, Beer and great discussions...

Big thank you to our sponsor InVision that makes this awesome meetup possible!

Cheers!
GDG Düsseldorf
